channel.title: [request Server crash detector (restarter)
channel.description:
Hello!
I'm going on vacation soon and i really want my server to auto restart if it crashes.
It's an old client and it crashes sometimes, so if anyone could send me a link to it (didn't find a working link on internet) i would be really thankfull :)
Greetz Qeruina

@qeruina wrote:

Thanks for helping me out guys The reason i need this is cause i’m running a really old PI named ‘‘ballscape’’ the reason why the server crashes is something i never had before, after 30-45 minutes the server crashes when someone logs out. They click on the logout button, then error connection to the server appears on their screen, but also on other players their screens, the server file also shows a huuuuge error and i have to restart it. Also the server resets after the crash, so it causes players to have a rollback

Justin Bieber:

I’ve never understood why people don’t just catch all runtime exceptions from the main method, and simply loop to start the server again? Or do most servers tend to swallow up exceptions and just sit in a broken state?

He’d have to force termination when it reaches this state before he leaves for vacation. I have a similar issue on one of my current projects based on a very old source, where when packets get junked up then no one can login anymore. This doesn’t terminate the server itself.

For now he’ll need to kill the server and then restart it, based on a timer, unless he has time to minimally fix it to work with sk8r’s. Once he gets back he should work on fixing the problem causing the error first, or at least add proper exception handling as you have stated already. I have to myself yet. :)[/quote]
He (and you) should log all the errors that show up using try/catches and a logger… Make it write to a text file so you don’t have to see it .

item.title: [request Server crash detector (restarter)
item.dc:creator: @xx_matty_xx Justin Bieber
item.description:
@xx_matty_xx wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:7, topic:552599”]I think the easiest way to make a “crash restarter” would be this:

[code=cmd]@echo off
GOTO Run

:Run
title Running Server
java -the server stuffs here-
GOTO Run
[/code]
At least, for windows.

What this would do, is whenever the java program terminated it would re-loop back to the “Run” command, which is the console executing the server.
A very shitty and probably bad way to do it, but it’ll work.[/quote]
this is a great way of doing it, and imo is the only correct way. as long as the server isn’t total horseshit then it should terminate when it enters an unrecoverable state.
